failure_modes.title: Unverified Store Availability
failure_modes.description: AI assumes ingredient availability at specific stores without confirmation or disclaimer.

examples.input: Give me a Mexican-inspired meal prep recipe using Costco rotisserie chicken that has at least 30g protein per serving and reheats well for 5 days
examples.output_issue: AI doesn't know if these ingredients are available at Costco. AI should let the user know that and that the recommendation is based on what is likely available at Costco.

examples.input: What's a high-protein Japanese teriyaki salmon recipe I can batch cook on Sunday using Costco's frozen salmon and TJ's teriyaki sauce?
examples.output_issue: AI doesn't know if these ingredients are available at Costco. AI should let the user know that and that the recommendation is based on what is likely available at Costco.

examples.input: Create an American-style turkey chili recipe with 35g+ protein per serving using ground turkey from Costco that freezes well for meal prep
examples.output_issue: AI doesn't know if these ingredients are available at Costco. AI should let the user know that and that the recommendation is based on what is likely available at Costco.

failure_modes.title: Incorrect Assumptions About User Intent
failure_modes.description: AI makes assumptions about user intent such as meal prep or bulk cooking when not requested.

examples.input: What can I cook with 2 lbs of ground turkey?
examples.output_issue: User didn't ask for meal prep for the week but AI provided meal prep instructions.
Follow-up question asking if the user is looking for more meal prep friendly ideas doesn't make sense with their initial ask.

examples.input: give me a recipe for lasagna that offers substitutions in case I don't have some of the ingredients
examples.output_issue: User isn't asking for meal prep but the intro says 'perfect for meal prep'.

failure_modes.title: Missing or Inappropriate Follow-up Questions
failure_modes.description: AI fails to ask relevant follow-up questions or asks irrelevant ones.

examples.input: I want to meal prep chicken breast, rice, and a vegetable. What ingredients should I use?
examples.output_issue: Agent should specify how many meals the recipe makes and ask how many meals the user wants to prep.

examples.input: i need to meal prep for 2 people using lean ground beef, quinoa and broccoli, give me the recipe with highest reviews
examples.output_issue: AI should ask how many days the user is meal prepping for and adjust ingredient amounts accordingly.

examples.input: Give me a Japanese-inspired meal prep recipe using Trader Joe's frozen edamame and their miso ginger broth with tofu for 25g+ protein
examples.output_issue: For meal prep questions, AI should ask how many days they are doing meal prep for.

failure_modes.title: Unsubstantiated Claims About Recipe Attributes
failure_modes.description: AI makes claims about recipe ratings, popularity, or cost without evidence or disclaimers.

examples.input: Best protein packed meal to make under 8$
examples.output_issue: No way the recipe bot can know this meal is under $8; AI should disclaim it is a best guess.

examples.input: give me the hightest rated grilled steak recipe with no marinade
examples.output_issue: If AI doesn't know if this is the highest rated recipe it should say so before giving a recommendation.

examples.input: give me the most popular oatmeal cookie recipe
examples.output_issue: If AI doesn't know what the most popular recipe is it should state that before giving a recommendation.
